void Window::Animate ( int  type,
nv::vec4< float >  value,
unsigned int  start,
unsigned int  duration,
int  interpolation,
Control *  ptr = NULL 
)

Creates a new animaion pushing it to the Animations list

Parameters:
type a enum for the tpye of animation to use
value the values to use for the animation
start how long to way untill you wish for the animation to start
duration How long (in miliseconds) you wish the animation to take
interpolation the interpolation type you wish to use.
ptr (optional) the pointer of the object affected by the animtion, currently only supported for color

bool Window::HitTest ( float  mx,
float  my,
float *  p 
)

Preforms a hit test on the window.

The functions finds the mouse coords in object space, thus working with 3d rotation, and figures out if they are inside the window.

Problems : None.

Threadsafe : No.

Parameters:
mx the mouse's x coordinate
my the mouse's y coordinate
p the projection matrix's array
Returns:
true if the hit test was succful
Exceptions:
nothing
